Coupe Café-Amande Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginSPONSOREDCoupe Café-AmandeSponsored by NespressoFacebookPinterestTwitterEmailCAVANAUGH2 servingsCrunchy, toasty, and sugary sweet, this unique dessert gets an added kick from Nespresso Variations Paris Madeleine coffee, developed by chef Daniel Rose for our Paris in New York dinner.PrintIngredientsFor the nougatine:¾ cup water2 ¼ cups sugar½ cup glucose3 cups slivered almonds, lightly toastedFor the granite café-amande:1 cup Nespresso Variations Paris Madeleine coffee2 Tbsp. sugar¼ cup amaretto (almond liquor)Recipe PreparationFor the nougatine:Bring the water, sugar, and glucose to a boil in a medium saucepan. As the sugar begins to caramelize, add the slivered almonds and continue to cook until golden brown.Spread the mixture on a nonstick pan and leave to cool and harden. Once cool, roughly chop the nougatine.For the granite café-amande:Mix all the ingredients together in a large measuring cup. Pour into a loaf pan and transfer to the freezer.
